newsitem.title: UK: UK shares open lower, BTR plummets on profit alert.
newsitem.headline: UK shares open lower, BTR plummets on profit alert.

text.p: UK stocks opened lower on Thursday, back-tracking from Wednesday's record close and unsettled by the latest sharp fall on Wall Street.

With a profit warning from industrial conglomerate BTR providing the latest signal of damage done by the strong pound, the FTSE 100 index was down 17.0 points at 4,520.5 by 0736 GMT. Decliners were in a 17-to-one majority and BTR was down 18-1/2p or 6.9 percent at 249p.
Dealers said the market was due for a consolidation after this week's record-breaking advance but said the market's undertone remained firm.
